articles.title: Kim Jong Il Inspects Kim Chaek Iron and Steel Complex
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Inspects Kim Chaek Iron and Steel Complex 
Pyongyang, April 20 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il provided field guidance to the Kim Chaek Iron and Steel Complex dynamically advancing in the van of the drive for effecting a great surge.
					 He went round a hot-rolling shop and various other production processes to learn in detail about the production and technological updating at the complex.
					
					 Watching the newly built high temperature air combustion heating furnace put on a CNC basis at the hot-rolling shop, he expressed great satisfaction over the fact that the workers of the complex built another giant structure capable of placing the metal industry on a Juche-oriented and modern basis and radically increasing the production of iron and steel as befitting the eldest son of the country.
					
					 The construction of the above-said heating furnace made it possible to produce as many billets as they want by using as fuel the gas from the furnace, not using heavy oil at all, he said, highly appreciating the remarkable technological progress being made in all processes as required by the era of knowledge-based economy.
					
					 He extended thanks to the officials, workers and technicians of the complex and other domain related to it for making a big contribution to putting the metal industry on a Juche-oriented and modern basis while steadily boosting the production of iron and steel.
					
					 The complex plays a very important role in the nation's economic development, he noted, setting forth important tasks to be carried out by it.
					
					 He said that the most important task facing the complex is to expand the scope of the Juche iron production, attain the goal of placing production on a CNC basis earlier than scheduled and operate not only the hot-rolling process but the cold-rolling process in the indigenous manner with a view to sufficiently supplying varieties and diverse standards of iron and steel required by various sectors of the national economy.
					
					 The relevant enterprises have important roles to play for keeping the production going at a high rate at the complex, he said, adding that it is necessary for power stations, mines and coal mines in charge of the supply of electricity, raw materials and fuel to supply more power, concentrated iron ore and coal to it in time.
					
					 It is the Party's intention to settle all the issues arising in building an economic power on the basis of science and technology, he noted, underlining the need for the complex to continue staging vigorous campaigns to put overall production processes on a higher modern and CNC basis as required by the era of knowledge-based economy in order to keep the iron and steel production going at a high rate.
					
					 He expressed great expectation and belief that the heroic workers of the complex would successfully fulfill the honorable tasks given to them by the party as they established a tradition of loyalty by devotedly upholding the Central Committee of the WPK with the increased production of iron and steel in each grim period of the revolution and making a great contribution to the building of a self-supporting national economy and the socialist construction. 
					
					 He was accompanied by Kim Ki Nam, member of the Political Bureau and secretary of the C.C., the WPK, Kim Kyong Hui, member of the Political Bureau and department director of the C.C., the WPK, Jang Song Thaek, alternate member of the Political Bureau of the C.C., the WPK and vice-chairman of the NDC, Thae Jong Su, alternate member of the Political Bureau and secretary of the C.C., the WPK, and Ju Kyu Chang, alternate member of the Political Bureau and department director of the C.C., the WPK.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il Inspects Newly Built Foodstuff Factory
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Inspects Newly Built Foodstuff Factory 
Pyongyang, April 20 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il gave field guidance to the newly built Susongchon General Foodstuff Factory in North Hamgyong Province.
					 After being briefed on the factory before a huge map showing the panoramic view of the factory, Kim Jong Il went round various production processes including candy, biscuit, bread and wine shops to learn in detail about the technical equipment and production there. 
					
					 Modern foodstuff factories have been built in every province of the country following the example set by the Samilpho Special Products Factory to pay off profusely, he said, adding that this proves that our officials are able to bring about a signal turn in improving the standard of people's living when they work hard, bravely overcoming bottlenecks and difficulties under the uplifted slogan of the party "We serve the people!" 
					
					 Then he listened to songs full of optimism presented by officials and workers of the factory. Noting that for the workers of the country work precisely means songs and joy, he added that is the rich emotion of the workers who have become the master of the country and the factory. 
					
					 Pointing out that the factory has an important duty and role to perform in improving the diet of the people in the province, he put forward tasks to be fulfilled by the factory. 
					
					 It is the consistent policy maintained by the WPK in the building of light industry to develop light industry on the basis of natural resources and materials available in the country, he said, underscoring the need for the factory to pay primary attention to the work to actively tap and use the locally available raw materials in order to ensure stable production at it.  
					
					 In order to keep the foodstuff in best quality at the factory, it should ensure the quality, purity and size of raw and other materials as required by science and technology and establish a strict regulation and order for thoroughly meeting the needs of technical rules and standard regulations of operation, he said. 
					
					 He expressed expectation and belief that the employees of the factory would make a greater leap forward in the production as required by the stirring era when a great drive is now making dynamic progress to build a thriving nation. 
					
					 He was accompanied by Kim Ki Nam, member of the Political Bureau and secretary of the C.C., the WPK, Kim Kyong Hui, member of the Political Bureau and department director of the C.C., the WPK, Jang Song Thaek, alternate member of the Political Bureau of the C.C., the WPK and vice-chairman of the National Defence Commission, Thae Jong Su, alternate member of the Political Bureau and secretary of the C.C., the WPK, and Ju Kyu Chang, alternate member of the Political Bureau and department director of the C.C., the WPK.

articles.title: Choe Yong Rim Congratulates Kazakh PM
articles.content:
Choe Yong Rim Congratulates Kazakh PM
Pyongyang, April 20 (KCNA) -- Choe Yong Rim, premier of the Cabinet, Monday sent a congratulatory message to Karim Masimov upon his reappointment as Prime Minister of the Republic of Kazakhstan.
					 Expressing belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would grow stronger in the mutual interests, the message wished him success in his work for the country's prosperity. 
					
					 On the same day, Pak Ui Chun, foreign minister, sent a similar message to Erzhan Kazikhanov upon his appointment as foreign minister of Kazakhstan.

articles.title: Mongolian Party Delegation Arrives
articles.content:
Mongolian Party Delegation Arrives
 Pyongyang, April 20 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the Mongolian People's Party led by General Secretary U. Khurelsukh arrived here on Wednesday.

articles.title: Mongolian Delegation Feted
articles.content:
Mongolian Delegation Feted
						
 Pyongyang, April 20 (KCNA) -- The Central Committee of the  Workers' Party of Korea Wednesday gave a reception for the delegation of the Mongolian People's Party on a visit to the DPRK. 
					 Present on invitation were the members of the delegation led by General Secretary U. Khurelsukh and Mongolian Ambassador to the DPRK Sodovjamts Khurelbaatar and staff members of the embassy. 
					
					 Secretary Choe Thae Bok and Vice-department Director Ri Yong Chol and other officials of the C.C., the WPK were on hand.
					
					 Choe in his speech said that the MPP has dynamically led the struggle for the Mongolian people's freedom and happiness as a party of a long history.
					
					 He said that Korea and Mongolia are neighboring countries in Northeast Asia and they are linked as one for the regional peace and stability and common prosperity. 
					
					 He expressed determination to boost the friendly relations between the two parties and countries provided by President Kim Il Sung and the leaders of Mongolia of elder generation. 
					
					 U. Khurelsukh in his speech said that the MPP and the WPK played a great role in developing the friendly relations between the two countries in the past.
					
					 The Mongolian delegation's recent visit to the DPRK will contribute to boosting the friendly relations between the two parties which have a long-standing tradition, he stressed.
					
					 He expressed belief that the Korean people would significantly commemorate the centenary of birth of President Kim Il Sung.
					
					 He wished the Korean people greater success in the struggle for achieving prosperity and reunification of the country under the leadership of Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: 13th Kimilsungia Festival Closes
articles.content:
13th Kimilsungia Festival Closes
 Pyongyang, April 20 (KCNA) -- The 13th Kimilsungia Festival, which opened on April 13 in Pyongyang, closed with due ceremony at the Kimilsungia-Kimjongilia Exhibition on Wednesday. 
					The festival drew more than 200,000 visitors every day, adding to significant commemoration of the birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung.
					
					 Present at the ceremony were Yang Hyong Sop and officials of ministries and national institutions, servicepersons, working people from all social strata, members of delegations of overseas compatriots and overseas compatriots. 
					
					 Present there on invitation were Indonesian Ambassador to the DPRK Nasri Gustaman and staff members of the embassy and foreign guests. 
					
					 An Tong Chun, DPRK minister of Culture, said in his closing address that the festival took place successfully thanks to the unanimous desire and sincerity of the Korean people and the progressive humankind to hold the President as the sun of Juche for all ages. 
					
					 He underlined the need to dynamically make an all-out offensive, an all-out breakthrough for translating the President's desire for building a prosperous and powerful nation so as to commemorate the centenary of his birth as the greatest holiday of Kim Il Sung's nation and the great auspicious event in the history of humankind and make the festival of immortal flowers more splendid and significant. 
					
					 He underscored the need to positively research, cultivate and spread Kimilsungia so as to bring into full bloom the flower of sun in every part of the world as well as the hearts of humankind in the era of independence.

articles.title: 13th Kimilsungia Festival Draws Full House
articles.content:
13th Kimilsungia Festival Draws Full House
 Pyongyang, April 20 (KCNA) -- More than 200,000 local and foreign people and overseas Koreans have visited the 13th Kimilsungia Festival.
					 The flower festival was opened in Pyongyang on April 13 in commemoration of President Kim Il Sung's birth anniversary (April 15).
					
					 Sin Kum Chol, a 61-year-old man living in Central District, Pyongyang, told KCNA that the festival reflected deep reverence of the people for the President and that he was most impressed by the flowers presented by the Ministry of State Construction Control.
					
					 Song Mi Ae, a 26-year-old worker of the Pyongyang 326 Electric Wire Factory, said she was fascinated by all exhibits, particularly the flowers cultivated by the Ministry of Light Industry.

articles.title: Flower Festival Draws Diplomatic Missions
articles.content:
Flower Festival Draws Diplomatic Missions
 Pyongyang, April 20 (KCNA) -- Included in the participants in the 13th Kimilsungia Festival were diplomatic missions in Pyongyang.
					 The stand of the Bureau of Diplomatic Corps Affairs displays Kimilsungia pots presented by the Chinese, Cambodian and other embassies in Pyongyang.
					
					 Missions of international organizations, including the World Health Organization, in Pyongyang also presented flowers to the stand.
					
					 The Indonesian embassy had its own stand in the festival with a picture of President Kim Il Sung being with ex-President of Indonesia Sukarno. The picture was taken in April Juche 54 (1965) when Kim Il Sung was visiting Indonesia.
					
					 During his visit to Indonesia, Sukarno suggested naming a newly bred flower after Kim Il Sung. 
					
					 The festival came to a successful end on Wednesday.

articles.title: Kimilsungia Festival Venue Visited by Many Foreigners
articles.content:
Kimilsungia Festival Venue Visited by Many Foreigners
 Pyongyang, April 20 (KCNA) -- Many foreigners and overseas compatriots visited the venue of the 13th Kimilsungia Festival on the occasion of the birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung.
					 They gave their deep impressions of the festival after the visit.
					
					 Lazarenko Veronika, a member of the "Step-Class" Dance Troupe of Ukraine, said that she could not repress admiration at the festival whose venue was decorated with Kimilsungia, rare flower bearing the august name of the President. Here in Korea I saw the most wonderful flower festival in the world, she added.
					
					 Iris Rauni Carita Klimenko, a member of the musical company of Finland, said that they were totally fascinated by beauty of Kimilsungia.
					
					 She further said: Sincerity, dedicated by every participant in the festival to cultivation of flowers on display, makes us clearly realize that Kim Il Sung is the great father of the people.
					
					 Choe Tong Won, head of the support group for the Art Troupe of Koreans in China, said that through the visit they deeply felt the faith and will of the people in the homeland to hold the President in high esteem forever.
					
					 Kwak U, a member of the support group, said that the DPRK is the only country in the world to hold the festival with the flowers bearing the august name of its leader.
					
					Paek Thae Bom, a member of the Art Troupe of Koreans in the U.S., noted that the visit offered him an opportunity to keenly feel the personality of the President as a great man and the strong will of the people in the homeland to realize his desire at any cost. The world will see how Kim Il Sung's Korea, the country of the sun, rises up as a thriving nation, he added.

articles.title: Juche Idea Praised by Australian Personage
articles.content:
Juche Idea Praised by Australian Personage
 Pyongyang, April 20 (KCNA) -- Raymond Ferguson, national secretary of the Australia-DPRK Association for Friendship and Culture, had an interview with KCNA on April 18. 
					 He, vice-chairman of the Asia-Pacific regional preparatory committee for commemorating the centenary of birth of President Kim Il Sung, said: 
					
					 The Juche idea founded by Kim Il Sung is the great idea whose validity has been confirmed in practice, and it serves as the source of all victories of the Korean people. 
					
					 During the stay in the DPRK he deeply felt this truth, going round different places, he said, adding: 
					
					 Under the banner of the Juche idea the Korean people have achieved signal successes in all fields. 
					
					 Socialist Korea is now displaying its might all over the world. 
					
					 This is unthinkable without the Juche idea. 
					
					 The President enlisted the unfailing energy of the popular masses to turn Korea into a socialist power independent in politics, self-supporting in economy and self-reliant in national defence. 
					
					 The Korean army and people are now pushing ahead with the building of a thriving nation, true to the leadership of Kim Jong Il. 
					
					 Expressing the will to intensify the action for significantly commemorating the Day of the Sun in 2012, Raymond Ferguson went on to say:
					
					 We are going to issue an appeal fully supporting the decision of the consultative meeting of senior officials of the international preparatory committee for commemorating the centenary of birth of President Kim Il Sung, which will be sent to all preparatory committees. 
					
					 We will also widely introduce the exploits of Kim Il Sung and activate the work to boost friendship, unity and cooperation with the Korean people. 
					
					 Korean socialism is invincible as there are the Juche idea and the Songun leadership of Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: Meeting of Forerunners Held
articles.content:
Meeting of Forerunners Held
 Pyongyang, April 20 (KCNA) -- A meeting of forerunners of the "Lathe No. 26" Model Machine Movement in the era of Songun took place in Pyongyang on Wednesday.
					 The meeting reviewed the successes and experience achieved in the movement under the leadership of the Workers' Party of Korea over the past years. And it discussed the matter of developing the movement onto a new higher stage as required by the era of knowledge-based economy in which the drive of pushing back the frontiers of latest science and technology is under way. 
					
					 Present there were Kim Yong Nam and Choe Yong Rim, officials of working people's organizations, ministries and national institutions and officials concerned. 
					
					Kim Yong Nam, member of the Presidium of the Political Bureau of the C.C., the WPK and president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, delivered General Secretary Kim Jong Il's work "On Developing the 'Lathe No. 26' Model Machine Movement onto a New Higher Stage in Keeping with the Requirement of the Great Drive for Building a Thriving Nation" at the meeting.
					
					 The work, published on March 30, Juche 100 (2011), deals with validity and vitality of the movement which has developed in depth under the leadership of the WPK. It also clarifies the orientation and ways for updating machines and equipment and production processes as required by the developing reality.
					
					 Hyon Sang Ju, chairman of the C.C., the Genera Federation of Trade Unions of Korea, said in his report that the work is a highly important guideline that the officials and working people should always hold fast to in their efforts to push ahead with CNC, modernization drive based on latest science and technology and increase the might of the Juche-oriented industry. 
					
					 In spring of 1961 Kim Jong Il showed a shining example in management of equipment at the Pyongyang Textile Machine Factory, the reporter said, adding:
					
					 In the early 1980s, the WPK took a radical step to develop the model machine movement into the "Lathe No. 26" Model Machine Movement so that the vitality of this movement could be displayed to the full. 
					
					 The movement has been conducted vigorously at industrial establishments, farms, etc. over the past years. In this period at least 10,000 workshops and more than 11,800 industrial establishments won the title of "Lathe No. 26" Model Unit or the title of Twice "Lathe No. 26" Model Unit. 890 workshops and over 1,600 factories, enterprises and farms obtained "Lathe No. 26" Model Prize and more than 100 workshop, factories and enterprises Twice "Lathe No. 26" Model Prize.
					
					 The reporter stressed the need for all officials and working people to intensify the movement in the extraordinary creative spirit and the strong spirit of self-reliance with high national pride and strong pluck that Korea does what it is determined to do and thus contribute to accelerating the victorious great drive for building a thriving nation. 
					
					 Then there were speeches.

articles.title: New Stamps Issued
articles.content:
New Stamps Issued  
 Pyongyang, April 20 (KCNA) -- The State Stamp Bureau of the DPRK issued eight kinds of new stamps introducing Pyongyang.
					 Three of them contain pictures of the native home of President Kim Il Sung in Mangyongdae, and the Party Founding Museum and Arch of Triumph associated with his great feats. 
					
					 Four other stamps introduce the People's Palace of Culture, Pyongyang Metro, Mangyongdae Schoolchildren's Palace and State Theatre.
					
					 Seen in the last one is a picture of May Day Stadium famous for the grand gymnastic and artistic performance "Arirang".

articles.title: Scientist Famous for Development of Health Drinks
articles.content:
Scientist Famous for Development of Health Drinks
						
 Pyongyang, April 20 (KCNA) -- Pyongyang Jang Chol Gu University of Commerce has a scientist who has developed various kinds of health drinks.
					 Ri Ki Sun, 54, succeeded in putting the processing methods of functional health drinks on a scientific basis.
					
					 She found out a new method of brewing Makkoli (crude liquor) in a simple way through yeast fermentation. 
					
					 The method, which preserves the original flavor of the traditional drink, has been well received by public catering establishments.
					
					 By applying lactic acid bacteria, she developed maize drinks and chlorella-vegetable juice.
					
					 She also made health drinks with pumpkin, carrot, tomato, spinach and cabbage.

articles.title: Japan's Buddhist Image Made by Korean Sculptor
articles.content:
Japan's Buddhist Image Made by Korean Sculptor
 Pyongyang, April 20 (KCNA) -- There is a great image of Buddha in the Todaiji Temple in Nara Prefecture, Japan.
					 The image was made by Kuk Ma Ryo, a famous sculptor of Paekje, an ancient state of Korea.
					
					 He lived in Kuninika Village, Katsunagi County, Yamato Kingdom.
					
					 Buddhist images were made by him in Japan at that time.
					
					 The large idol, 16 meters high and over 380 tons weigh, was made in 752 but became known to the public five years later along with the construction of the temple.
					
					 It was restored several times.
					
					 The head of the image was remolded after being melted by a fire, with other parts still remaining as they were.
					
					 The platform is decorated with over 50 lotus flowers, each engraved with Buddhist image.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun on WPK's Effective Mode of Drive
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun on WPK's Effective Mode of Drive
						
 Pyongyang, April 20 (KCNA) -- The DPRK, called Songun Korea, is dashing toward to a thriving nation, meeting every challenge of the imperialist reactionaries. Its invincible stamina fully reflects the work style of the Workers' Party of Korea which wins one victory after another by dint of bold offensive. 
					 Rodong Sinmun Wednesday stresses this in a bylined article.
					
					 The WPK has made continued progress for scores of years, leading the revolution and construction to victory, the article says, adding:
					
					 The staunch offensive spirit of the WPK never allowing stagnation and stalemate made it possible to create a heroic epic of creation and innovation in which a socialist power was built from scratch on the strength of the great Chollima advance. The history of grand socialist construction in the 1970s and the 1980s, which brought the heyday in the era of the Workers' Party to the tune of the drum of revolution, shines as a history of the stubborn offensive by the WPK at the pace of Chollima plus speed campaign. 
					
					 The Korean army and people successfully concluded the arduous march, the forced march, with confidence in sure victory and offensive spirit implanted by the WPK even in the worst period of manifold adversity.
					
					 The WPK is a revolutionary and militant party and the indomitable spirit of offensive is what keeps the WPK alive. 
					
					 The great revolutionary surge is a traditional offensive mode of the WPK and spurs on making uninterrupted innovation and advance serve as a powerful motive force for offensive.

articles.title: Bird-flu and Foot-and-Mouth Diseases Break Out in S. Korea
articles.content:
Bird-flu and Foot-and-Mouth Diseases Break Out in S. Korea 
Pyongyang, April 20 (KCNA) -- Bird-flu and foot-and-mouth diseases broke out in Yongchon, North Kyongsang Province, on April 16 and 17, according to south Korean CBS and KBS. 
					 More than 30,000 fowls and many pigs in the area were buried.

articles.title: Indonesian Party Leader Sends Floral Basket to DPRK Embassy
articles.content:
Indonesian Party Leader Sends Floral Basket to DPRK Embassy 
 Pyongyang, April 20 (KCNA) -- Megawati Soekarnoputri, general chairwoman of the Central Directive Council of the Indonesian Democratic Party of Struggle, sent a floral basket to the DPRK embassy in Jakarta on April 14 on the occasion of April holidays in the DPRK.

articles.title: Visits to DPRK Embassies Paid on Day of Sun
articles.content:
Visits to DPRK Embassies Paid on Day of Sun
						
 Pyongyang, April 20 (KCNA) -- Personages of Bangladesh, Russia and Nepal visited the DPRK embassies in their countries between April 2 and 15 to commemorate the birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung.
					 They included the chairman of the C.C., the Workers' Party, the general secretary of the C.C., the Communist Party, the general secretary of the C.C., the Socialist Party, the chairman of the Central Executive Committee of the National Socialist Party and the president of the People's League of Bangladesh, the chairman of the Bangladesh Institute of the Juche Idea and the secretary general of the Bangladesh-Korea Friendship and Solidarity Committee, the general director of the Bneshutorgprom Co. Ltd. of Russia, the chairman of the Russian Association for the Study of the Juche Idea and personages of the Nepali National Preparatory Committee for Commemorating the Day of the Sun and February 16, the Nepal-Korea Friendship Association, the Nepal Journalist Association for the Study of the Juche Idea and Songun Politics, the Forum of National Press Club of Nepal for the Study of Songun Politics and the Nepalese Association for Supporting the Songun Politics. 
					
					They laid floral baskets and bouquets before the full-length portraits of President Kim Il Sung and General Secretary Kim Jong Il standing together and made bows.

articles.title: Foreign Papers Commemorate Kim Il Sung's Birthday
articles.content:
Foreign Papers Commemorate Kim Il Sung's Birthday
 Pyongyang, April 20 (KCNA) -- Newspapers of different countries carried special write-ups with the portrait of smiling President Kim Il Sung and photos on his revolutionary activities to commemorate his birth anniversary.
					 The Lao newspaper Congtap Pasason Lao on April 11 said in an article that the President was a great leader of the people. The article elaborated on the ideological and theoretical feats he performed while leading the revolution and construction to victory. 
					
					 Malaysia's Guang Ming Daily on April 9 carried an article with pictures of the President's native home in Mangyongdae. The article told about his exploits for nation building. 
					
					 The Uruguayan paper La Juventud on April 10 carried an article titled "Day of Sun April 15, 99th Birth Anniversary of President Kim Il Sung" and other articles under the subtitles of "Legendary Hero," "Military Genius" and "Iron-willed Commander." 
					
					 The Indian paper Defense and Humanity on April 11 carried articles titled "Great Man of Century," "Statesman of Human Love" and "75 Years under the Banner of Great Unity of Entire Nation" under the headline of "On the Occasion of the 99th Birth Anniversary of President Kim Il Sung."
					
					 On the same day the Indian paper Science, Technology and Education News carried an article on the fact that the President successfully pursued the politics of love and trust in the people for the first time in history. 
					
					 Russian newspapers including Serp I Molot and Veteran ran special write-ups with portraits of Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il and photos of peerlessly great persons.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung's Work Posted on Internet Website in UK
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung's Work Posted on Internet Website in UK 
 Pyongyang, April 20 (KCNA) -- The British Association for the Study of Songun Policy posted the gist of President Kim Il Sung's work "10-Point Programme of the Great Unity of the Whole Nation for the Reunification of the Country" on its Internet homepage on April 13. 
					 The work, published on April 6, Juche 82 (1993), comprehensively touches on the ways for achieving the great unity of the whole Korean nation.
					
					 The ways call for founding a unified state through great national unity, achieving unity on the basis of love for nation and spirit of national independence, promoting co-existence, co-prosperity and common interests and ending all political disputes that trigger division and confrontation among fellow countrymen. They also call upon the north and the south to trust each other and unite and all Koreans to join hands on the road for national reunification irrespective of their differing idea and ism.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung's Birth Anniversary Commemorated by Int'l Organization
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung's Birth Anniversary Commemorated by Int'l Organization 
 Pyongyang, April 20 (KCNA) -- An event of laying a floral basket before the portrait of smiling President Kim Il Sung was held by the Organization of Solidarity of the Peoples of Africa, Asia and Latin America on April 14 to commemorate his birth anniversary. 
					 Present there were Secretary General Alfonso Fraga Perez and members of the organization and DPRK Ambassador to Cuba Kwon Sung Chol and embassy officials. 
					
					 The participants paid homage to Kim Il Sung after placing the floral basket before his portrait.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung's Feats Lauded Abroad
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung's Feats Lauded Abroad 
						
 Pyongyang, April 20 (KCNA) -- Personages of Peru and Finland issued statements on April 10 to commemorate the birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung. 
					 The chairman of the People's Front of Workers, Peasants and Students of Peru said in his statement that Kim Il Sung was a legendary hero of mankind as he liberated the country and the nation from the Japanese imperialists' colonial yoke, won in the Korean war, provoked by the U.S. imperialists, and laid the foundation for a thriving socialist nation in Korea.
					
					 The President always lives in the hearts of the Korean people for his great feats and the world people boundlessly revere him, the chairman added. 
					
					 The chairman of the Finland-Korea Society in a statement said that Kim Il Sung, eternal leader of the DPRK, was a prominent thinker-theoretician and the greatest statesman. 
					
					 His revolutionary life and exploits for happiness of the country and the nation and independence carry the rare wisdom, great attraction and noble personality that could be possessed only by him, the statement said. 
					
					 His undying ideo-theoretical exploits greatly encourage the struggle of the world progressives and display big influence, it added.

articles.title: Situation Gets Worse at Fukushima Nuclear Power Plant
articles.content:
Situation Gets Worse at Fukushima Nuclear Power Plant
 Pyongyang, April 20 (KCNA) -- Radioactive substances of high concentration are ceaselessly leaking from the Fukushima Daiichi Nuclear Power Plant in Japan, darkening the prospect of tiding over the crisis.
					 The Tokyo Electric Power Co. reported on April 18 that radioactive substances of high concentration were detected in flooding waters at the spent nuclear fuel pool of No. 2 reactor of the plant.
					
					According to the test results, cesium-134 and -137 were confirmed to be 160,000Bq and 150,000Bq each per 1cc of contaminated water and iodine-131 to be 4,100Bq.
					
					 This is believed to originate from the reactor core where fuel rods have been partially melted, TEPCO said. 
					
					 On the same day, the Ministry of Economy, Trade and Industry of Japan said, citing the data measured at the buildings of Nos. 1 and 3 reactors on Sunday, that the radiation level was 49mSv and 57mSv respectively per hour.
					
					 It is said that if people stay in the 57-millisievert-environment for hour and a half hours, they would be exposed to more than the permissible level of 250 millisieverts.
					
					 Amid the crisis growing at the Fukushima Daiichi Nuclear Power Plant, south Korea's KBS reported on Monday that trace amounts of radioactive substances were still detected at 12 monitoring stations in the southern area of the Korean Peninsula.
					
					 In the meantime, the toll of the quake and tsunami is increasing in Japan.  
					
					The number of deaths has increased to 13,895 and the missing to 13 864 as of 18:00 on Monday, according to the National Police Agency of Japan.
					
					 Asahi Shimbun Tuesday reported, citing the survey data by Japan's National Land and Geography Agency that the areas flooded by tsunami extend 561 square kilometers in total, covering 62 cities, chos and muras in six prefectures in the Pacific coastal region from Aomori Prefecture to Chiba Prefecture.
					
					 According to it, Miyagi Prefecture, most seriously hit by tsunami, accounts for more than half of the inundated areas, or 327 square kilometers.
					
					 At present lands in the northeastern coastal region of Japan whose ground went down are getting submerged in water.

articles.title: 6th Congress of Communist Party of Cuba Opens
articles.content:
6th Congress of Communist Party of Cuba Opens 
 Havana, April 18 (KCNA) -- The 6th Congress of the Communist Party of Cuba was opened in Havana on Saturday.
					 Raul Castro Ruz, second secretary of the C.C., the CPC, delivered a report of the CPC Central Committee at the congress.
					
					 The history has proven that the sovereignty of each country and nation can only be conquered through Socialism, the reporter said, adding: 
					
					 In Cuba under socialism, there will never be space for "shock therapies" that go against the neediest; as opposed to the packages of measures lately enforced in the highly developed nations. The Revolution will not leave any Cuban helpless.
					
					 Referring to the plan to hold the Party Conference at the end of January 2012, he said that this National Conference would focus on enhancing the role of the Party as the main advocate of the interests of the Cuban people. 
					
					 The present world is very complicated, he noted, adding: 
					
					 The United States wages wars of conquest in Iraq and Afghanistan that have taken the lives of more than one million civilians.
					
					 Likewise, imperialism and the domestic reactionary forces connive to destabilize other countries while Israel oppresses and massacres the Palestinian people with complete impunity.
					
					 Noting that Cuba maintains its cooperation with many countries despite its complex economic situation, the reporter further said:
					
					 We shall continue helping the integrationist processes of the Bolivarian Alliance for the Peoples of Our America, the South Union and the Community of Latin American and Caribbean States.
					
					 We shall continue advocating International Law and supporting the principle of sovereign equality among the States as well as the right of the peoples to self-determination.
					
					 The U.S. administration has not changed its traditional policy aimed at discrediting and ousting the Cuban Revolution. 
					
					 It has not ceased to give sanctuary and to protect notorious terrorists while extending the suffering and unfair incarceration of the heroic Cuban five antiterrorist fighters.
					
					 If they want to cling on to their policy of hostility, blockade and subversion we are prepared to continue to face it.

articles.title: BRICS's Action against US Dollar-led Global Monetary and Financial System
articles.content:
BRICS's Action against U.S. Dollar-led Global Monetary and Financial System
						
Pyongyang, April 20 (KCNA) -- Deutsche Press－Agentur, DPA reported on April 14 that BRICS is challenging the U.S. dollar-led global monetary and financial system.
					The BRICS member nations called for reforming the dollar-centered international monetary system and decided to build up the alliance against U.S. dollar at the third BRICS Summit in China, it said, and went on: 
					
					 They also said that the monetary policy pursued by industrial countries led to inflation worldwide and plunged emerging economies into danger.

articles.title: Hu Jintao on Shared Mission of Asian People
articles.content:
Hu Jintao on Shared Mission of Asian People 
 Beijing, April 18 (KCNA) -- Chinese President Hu Jintao on Friday delivered a keynote speech at the opening ceremony of the 2011 annual meeting of the Boao Forum for Asia.
					 He said that the people of Asia have a shared mission to promote common development and build a harmonious Asia, and went on:
					
					 We need to respect diversity of civilizations and promote good-neighborly relations and share development opportunities and meet challenges together.
					
					 The Chinese people are keenly aware of the value of peace and the importance of development. China will unswervingly follow the path of peaceful development.

articles.title: China Stealth Fighter "Appears" to Have Made Second Flight
articles.content:
China Stealth Fighter "Appears" to Have Made Second Flight
 Beijing, April 18 (KCNA) -- China appears to have staged a second test-flight of a new stealth fighter jet from an airfield in Chengdu in southwestern Sichuan Province. 
					The test-flight runs for about 20 minutes and flied at a low altitude for a short time.
					
					 J-20 stealth fighter jet prototype will be deployed in 2017.

articles.title: Vice FM of Russia on Issue of Establishing MDS
articles.content:
Vice FM of Russia on Issue of Establishing MDS 
 Moscow, April 18 (KCNA) -- Vice Foreign Minister of Russia Aleksandr Grushko, in a recent interview with Itar-Tass, referred to the establishment of missile defence system in Europe.
					 Differences exist between Russia and NATO, he said, adding that single missile defence system should be established in Europe, not the two independent entities.

articles.title: Chairman of A Just Russia Elected
articles.content:
Chairman of A Just Russia Elected
 Moscow, April 18 (KCNA) -- Leader of a fraction of A Just Russia of the State Duma of Russia Nikolai Levichev was elected as the chairman of the party.
					 He enjoyed the overwhelming majority of support at the party congess held on April 16.

articles.title: Ecuadorian President Censures US for Suspension of Dialogue
articles.content:
Ecuadorian President Censures US for Suspension of Dialogue 
 Pyongyang, April 20 (KCNA) -- Ecuadorian President Rafael Correa in an interview on April 15 condemned the U.S. decision to indefinitely suspend bilateral dialogues.
					 This unilateral decision was made in response to the expulsion of the U.S. ambassador from Ecuador.
					
					 There is nothing to worry about and fear the U.S. decision, he said, adding that "the sovereignty of the country is priceless."

articles.title: US Drones Kill 957 Pakistanis in 2010
articles.content:
US Drones Kill 957 Pakistanis in 2010 
 Pyongyang, April 20 (KCNA) -- The U.S. forces in Afghanistan have continued air raids on Pakistan under the signboard of "anti-terrorism", killing many inhabitants. 
					 The Human Rights Commission of Pakistan issued its annual report on April 14 stating that American drone strikes killed 957 innocent people in Pakistan in 2010.

articles.title: Tornadoes Kill 45 People in US
articles.content:
Tornadoes Kill 45 People in US
 Pyongyang, April 20 (KCNA) -- 14 states of the U.S. suffered damage from the recent tornadoes.
					 More than 240 twisters were reported in those states from Thursday through Sunday, which killed 45 people, according to VOA.
					
					 They hit many buildings, cars, farmlands, etc.
					
					 There was fist-size hail in North Carolina.
					
					 Tornadoes stopped the supply of electricity to nuclear power plants in Virginia, bringing operation of two reactors to a halt.
					
					 Although the U.S. Nuclear Regulatory Commission declared that there was no leakage of radioactive materials from those nuclear power plants until now, there is increasing concern about their security, according to foreign media.
					
					 A state of emergency was declared in seriously hit states.

articles.title: Iran Test-Fires Missile System
articles.content:
Iran Test-Fires Missile System 
 Tehran, April 18 (KCNA) -- Iran has successfully test-fired its latest air-defense missile system recently. 
					 A high-ranking military official of the country said that the test was aimed at assessing the level of preparedness of Iran's defense systems deployed to defend Iran's sensitive nuclear facilities.
					
					 He said that the air-defense system will be unveiled in the near future.

articles.title: Airport Renovations Brisk in Brazil
articles.content:
Airport Renovations Brisk in Brazil
 Pyongyang, April 20 (KCNA) -- The renovations in airports for the World Cup are brisk in Brazil. 
					 The Brazilian government on April 14 announced that the renovations in the country's airports for the 2014 FIFA World Cup were proceeding as scheduled. 
					
					 The government is spending a lot of fund for the renovations.

articles.title: Quake Jolt Tonga and Taiwan
articles.content:
Quake Jolt Tonga and Taiwan
 Pyongyang, April 20 (KCNA) -- An earthquake measuring 6.0 on the Richter scale rocked Tonga on April 15. The epicenter was in waters in the northeastern part of the country. 
					 Meanwhile, a quake of magnitude 6.0 jolted the sea off northeast coast of Taiwan on April 16. Its epicenter was in depth of 130 km of the sea.

articles.title: High Food, Fuel Prices Threaten the Poor: World Bank Chief
articles.content:
High Food, Fuel Prices Threaten the Poor: World Bank Chief
 Pyongyang, April 20 (KCNA) -- Volatile food and fuel prices are threatening the world's poor, World Bank Group President Robert Zoellick said in a recent press interview.
					According to the latest edition of the World Bank's Food Price Watch, an additional 10-percent increase in global prices could drive an additional 10 million people below the 1.25 U.S. dollars extreme poverty line.

articles.title: Clausurado el XIII Festival de Kimilsungias
articles.content:
Clausurado el XIII Festival de Kimilsungias 
Pyongyang, 20 de abril (ATCC) -- Quedó clausurado el XIII Festival de Kimilsungias que había sido inaugurado el pasado día 13.
					Este festival visitado por más de 200 mil personas hizo aporte a conmemorar de modo más significativo el día de nacimiento del Presidente Kim Il Sung.
					
					El acto de clausura tuvo lugar el día 20 en la Exposición Permanente de Kimilsungia y Kimjongilia.
					
					En la ocasión participaron Yang Hyong Sop, los funcionarios de ministerios y órganos centrales, militares del Ejército Popular de Corea, trabajadores de varios estratos, los compatriotas coreanos en ultramar y sus delegaciones.
					
					Fueron invitados el embajador Nasri Gustaman y otros miembros de la embajada indonesia en Corea y otros huéspedes extranjeros.
					
					Al pronunciar el discurso de la ocasión, el ministro de Cultura An Tong Chun se refirió a la celebración exitosa del festival gracias al unánime anhelo del pueblo coreano y la humanidad progresista de enaltecer de generación en generación al Presidente como Sol del Juche.
					
					Exhortó a intensificar la ofensiva general para realizar el anhelo del Presidente de construir una patria próspera, de modo que el centenario de su nacimiento se registre como máxima fiesta de la nación de Kim Il Sung y gran júbilo de la humanidad.
					
					Destacó la necesidad de auspiciar el festival de Kimilsungias con mayor solemnidad y significado.
					
					Aseveró que se debe desplegar activamente la investigación sobre esas flores del Sol y la propaganda para su cultivo y difusión para que ellas florezcan en el alma de la humanidad que vive en la era de independencia.

articles.title: Más de 200 mil visitan la sede del XIII Festival de Kimilsungias
articles.content:
Más de 200 mil visitan la sede del XIII Festival de Kimilsungias
Pyongyang, 20 de abril (ATCC) -- Transcurrió con éxito el XIII Festival de Kimilsungias inaugurado el día 13 en esta capital.
					  Esta edición centró gran atención de los nacionales y extranjeras porque se abrió un año antes del centenario de nacimiento del Presidente             Kim Il Sung que se conmemoraría como máxima fiesta de la nación de Kim Il Sung y gran júbilo de significado histórico para la humanidad.
					
					  Visitaron la exhibición más de 200 mil militares del Ejército Popular de Corea, trabajadores de distintos sectores, jóvenes y niños escolares así como los extranjeros y compatriotas coreanos en ultramar.
					
					  En entrevista con la ATCC, Sin Kum Chol (de 61 años de edad) que vive en el municipio de Jung, dijo que le gustaron más el mostrador del Ministerio de Control Estatal de las Construcciones y los otros que tenían la miniatura de Mangyongdae, cuna de la revolución donde nació el Presidente, en la parte arriba y las Kimilsungias florecidas de pleno y exhibidas abajo en escalones.
					
					Continuó en tono solemne que los mostradores son una prueba elocuente de que el Presidente está siempre presente como sol de toda la humanidad.
					
					  La muchacha de 26 años de edad, Song Mi Ae, quien trabaja en la Fábrica de Alambres Eléctricos 326 de Pyongyang,  evaluó de más grandes y hermosas las flores del stand del Ministerio de Industria Ligera.
					
					Añadió que esas ejemplares reflejan la decisión de los funcionarios y la clase obrera de la rama de industria ligera de realizar lo que deseaba tanto el Presidente.

articles.title: Raymond Ferguson se entrevista con ATCC
articles.content:
Raymond Ferguson se entrevista con ATCC
						
Pyongyang, 20 de abril (ATCC) -- Raymond Ferguson, vicepresidente del comité preparatorio regional de Asia-Pacífico para el centenario de nacimiento del Presidente Kim Il Sung y secretario nacional de la Asociación de Amistad y Cultura Australia-RPDC, sostuvo el día 18 una rueda de prensa con la ATCC.
					Él destacó que la idea Juche, concebida por el Presidente, es un gran pensamiento cuya justeza fue confirmada en la práctica, y el factor de todas las victorias del pueblo coreano.
					
					Lo sentí en carne propia recorriendo varios lugares durante mi visita, dijo y prosiguió:
					
					Bajo la bandera de la idea Juche, el pueblo coreano logra grandes éxitos en todos los dominios y la Corea socialista demuestra hoy a todo el mundo su gran poderío.
					
					Esta realidad es inconcebible sin la idea Juche creada por el Presidente.
					
					Él convirtió a Corea en una potencia socialista de carácter independiente, autárquico y autodefensivo movilizando la fuerza inagotable de las masas populares.
					
					Hoy día, el ejército y el pueblo coreanos dan buen ritmo a la construcción de la gran potencia próspera acatando con fidelidad la guía de Su Excelencia       Kim Jong Il.
					
					Manifiesto en esta ocasión la voluntad de reforzar las actividades para conmemorar solemnemente el Día del Sol (15 de abril) de 2012.
					
					Nos proponemos publicar el llamamiento para apoyar totalmente la resolución aprobada en la reciente reunión consultiva de funcionarios directivos del comité internacional para el centenario de natalicio del Presidente y enviarlo a todos los comités preparatorios.
					
					Divulgaremos ampliamente las hazañas del Presidente y dinamizaremos las acciones destinadas a consolidar la amistad, unidad y cooperación con el pueblo coreano.
					
					El socialismo de la RPDC será invencible porque cuenta con la idea Juche y la guía del Songun de Su Excelencia Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: Ofensiva es modo de lucha del PTC, ratifica Rodong Sinmun
articles.content:
Ofensiva es modo de lucha del PTC, ratifica Rodong Sinmun
						
Pyongyang, 20 de abril (ATCC) -- En el temperamento de la Corea del Songun, que avanza a galope hacia la gran potencia próspera frustrando los desafíos de toda índole de la reacción imperialista, está el modo de lucha del Partido del Trabajo de Corea que sale siempre victorioso con la ofensiva intrépida. 
					Señala así el diario Rodong Sinmun en un artículo individual difundido en su edición de este miércoles y prosigue: 
					
					Durante varios decenios, el PTC viene conduciendo sólo a la senda de victorias la revolución y la construcción mediante el avance continuo. 
					
					El espíritu de ofensiva tenaz del PTC, que no se detiene nunca, escribió la epopeya de creaciones y saltos que permitieron construir desde nada una potencia socialista a través de la gran marcha de Chollima.
					
					La historia de construcción socialista en las décadas de 1970 y 1980 cuando se abrió la era de prosperidad del PTC se caracteriza por su ofensiva tenaz a la velocidad de Chollima (legendario corcel alado).
					
					En los tiempos de peores circunstancias, el ejército y el pueblo coreanos concluyeron victoriosamente la Marcha penosa, la forzada, con la fe y el temperamento de ataque que les enseñó el PTC. 
					
					El gran auge revolucionario es el tradicional modo de ataque del PTC y los ritmos de innovación continua y avance continuo dan buen impulso a los movilizados en la ofensiva para construir una gran potencia próspera.
